actualResults.title: Missing Security Headers on Root Index Page
actualResults.assessment: Valid new discovery - The pentest found that the application root endpoint is missing critical security headers (X-Frame-Options, CSP, X-XSS-Protection, X-Content-Type-Options, HSTS). This is a legitimate security vulnerability not covered in the expected findings, though related to defense-in-depth for the /xss25 XSS vulnerability.

actualResults.title: Server Version Information Disclosure
actualResults.assessment: Valid new discovery - The pentest identified that server headers expose Werkzeug version 1.0.1 and Python 3.13.3, allowing attackers to identify known vulnerabilities. This is a separate information disclosure vulnerability not included in expected findings.

actualResults.title: XSS Protection Disabled on Challenge Pages
actualResults.assessment: Valid new discovery - The pentest found that the /xss25 endpoint explicitly disables browser XSS protection via X-XSS-Protection: 0 header. While related to the XSS vulnerability, this is a specific security misconfiguration finding that extends beyond the blacklist bypass vulnerability.

actualResults.title: Missing CSRF Protection on xss25 Challenge Form
actualResults.assessment: Valid new discovery - The pentest identified missing CSRF tokens, Origin validation, and Referer validation on the /xss25 POST endpoint. This is a separate vulnerability class (CSRF) not covered in the expected XSS findings.

actualResults.title: Missing Security Headers - XSS Protection Disabled on /xss25
actualResults.assessment: Valid new discovery - Duplicate/comprehensive assessment of missing security headers specifically on the /xss25 endpoint, including disabled X-XSS-Protection and missing CSP, X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options, and HSTS headers.

matched.expectedTitle: Reflected XSS via Blacklist Bypass in XSS25
matched.actualTitle: Reflected XSS via Unvalidated Event Handlers in /xss25 Endpoint + HTML Injection - Unfiltered HTML Tags + Filter Bypass via HTML Comments via BASE Tag Injection
matched.matchReason: The expected finding describes a blacklist bypass vulnerability at /xss25. The actual findings confirm this vulnerability through multiple bypass techniques: (1) Unfiltered event handlers (oninput, onchange) bypass the blacklist, (2) HTML injection via unfiltered tags demonstrates the blacklist incompleteness, (3) DOM clobbering via BASE tag injection shows additional HTML tags not filtered, (4) Most critically, the HTML comments bypass technique directly confirms the blacklist can be evaded by splitting keywords with <!---->. All these findings represent the same core vulnerability: a flawed blacklist-based XSS filter at the /xss25 endpoint that can be bypassed in multiple ways to achieve arbitrary JavaScript execution.
